sid.description: The unique string that we created to identify the Execution resource.

account_sid.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created the Execution resource.

contact_channel_address.description: The phone number, SIP address or Client identifier that triggered the Execution. Phone numbers are in E.164 format (e.g. +16175551212). SIP addresses are formatted as `name@company.com`. Client identifiers are formatted `client:name`.

context.description: The current state of the Flow's Execution. As a flow executes, we save its state in this context. We save data that your widgets can access as variables in configuration fields or in text areas as variable substitution.

date_created.description: The date and time in GMT when the resource was created specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

date_updated.description: The date and time in GMT when the resource was last updated specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

url.description: The absolute URL of the resource.

execution_enum_status.description: The status of the Execution. Can be: `active` or `ended`.

account_sid.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created the ExecutionContext resource.

context.description: The current state of the Flow's Execution. As a flow executes, we save its state in this context. We save data that your widgets can access as variables in configuration fields or in text areas as variable substitution.

execution_sid.description: The SID of the context's Execution resource.

url.description: The absolute URL of the resource.

sid.description: The unique string that we created to identify the ExecutionStep resource.

account_sid.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created the ExecutionStep resource.

execution_sid.description: The SID of the Step's Execution resource.

parent_step_sid.description: The SID of the parent Step.

name.description: The event that caused the Flow to transition to the Step.

context.description: The current state of the Flow's Execution. As a flow executes, we save its state in this context. We save data that your widgets can access as variables in configuration fields or in text areas as variable substitution.

transitioned_from.description: The Widget that preceded the Widget for the Step.

transitioned_to.description: The Widget that will follow the Widget for the Step.

type.description: The type of the widget that was executed.

date_created.description: The date and time in GMT when the resource was created specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

date_updated.description: The date and time in GMT when the resource was last updated specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

url.description: The absolute URL of the resource.

account_sid.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created the ExecutionStepContext resource.

context.description: The current state of the Flow's Execution. As a flow executes, we save its state in this context. We save data that your widgets can access as variables in configuration fields or in text areas as variable substitution.

execution_sid.description: The SID of the context's Execution resource.

step_sid.description: The SID of the Step that the context is associated with.

url.description: The absolute URL of the resource.

sid.description: The unique string that we created to identify the Flow resource.

account_sid.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created the Flow resource.

friendly_name.description: The string that you assigned to describe the Flow.

revision.description: The latest revision number of the Flow's definition.

commit_message.description: Description of change made in the revision.

valid.description: Boolean if the flow definition is valid.

errors.description: List of error in the flow definition.

warnings.description: List of warnings in the flow definition.

date_updated.description: The date and time in GMT when the resource was last updated specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

url.description: The absolute URL of the resource.

links.description: The URLs of the Flow's nested resources.

flow_enum_status.description: The status of the Flow. Can be: `draft` or `published`.

info.title: Twilio - Studio
info.description: This is the public Twilio REST API.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Executions for the Flow.
get.summary: Retrieve a list of all Executions for the Flow.

parameters.name: FlowSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Flow with the Execution resources to read.

parameters.name: DateCreatedFrom
parameters.description: Only show Execution resources starting on or after this [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date-time, given as `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss-hh:mm`.

parameters.name: DateCreatedTo
parameters.description: Only show Execution resources starting before this [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date-time, given as `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss-hh:mm`.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page index. This value is simply for client state.

parameters.name: PageToken
parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

Access-Control-Allow-Origin.description: Specify the origin(s) allowed to access the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Methods.description: Specify the HTTP methods allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Headers.description: Specify the headers allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Credentials.description: Indicates whether the browser should include credentials

post.description: Triggers a new Execution for the Flow
post.summary: Triggers a new Execution for the Flow

parameters.name: FlowSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Excecution's Flow.

Access-Control-Allow-Origin.description: Specify the origin(s) allowed to access the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Methods.description: Specify the HTTP methods allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Headers.description: Specify the headers allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Credentials.description: Indicates whether the browser should include credentials

To.description: The Contact phone number to start a Studio Flow Execution, available as variable `{{contact.channel.address}}`.

From.description: The Twilio phone number to send messages or initiate calls from during the Flow's Execution. Available as variable `{{flow.channel.address}}`. For SMS, this can also be a Messaging Service SID.

Parameters.description: JSON data that will be added to the Flow's context and that can be accessed as variables inside your Flow. For example, if you pass in `Parameters={"name":"Zeke"}`, a widget in your Flow can reference the variable `{{flow.data.name}}`, which returns "Zeke". Note: the JSON value must explicitly be passed as a string, not as a hash object. Depending on your particular HTTP library, you may need to add quotes or URL encode the JSON string.

Access-Control-Allow-Credentials.description: Indicates whether the browser should include credentials
